Methodology: 3 Strategic Planning

learnings.details:
3 Strategic Planning

- Long-term practice technology roadmaps

- Cost-benefit analysis frameworks

- Scalability considerations for growing practices

- Succession planning and knowledge transfer



---



## Assessment and Certification



### Formative Assessment

- Module quizzes testing knowledge retention

- Case study analyses demonstrating practical application

- Group discussions and peer learning activities

- Practical exercises with real-world scenarios



### Summative Assessment

- Comprehensive case study requiring integration of legal, clinical, and practical considerations

- Development of a practice-specific AI scribe implementation plan

- Demonstration of consent procedures and patient communication

- Risk assessment and mitigation strategy presentation



### Certification Requirements

- Attendance at all modules (minimum 90%)

- Satisfactory completion of all practical exercises

- Passing grade on final assessment (75% minimum)

- Commitment to ongoing professional development in AI literacy



---



## Resources and References



### Essential Reading

- RACGP Artificial Intelligence (AI) Scribes Fact Sheet

- GPSA Position Statement: Artificial Intelligence in GP Supervision

- Avant AI Scribes Checklist

- MIPS AI Scribes Fact Sheet and Medicolegal Guidance

- ACRRM Checklist for AI-Based Scribing Software



### Supplementary Materials

- Sample consent forms and privacy policies

- Vendor comparison matrices

- Risk assessment templates

- Implementation checklists and timelines

- Case study library with real-world examples



### Online Resources

- RACGP AI in Primary Care Position Statement: [racgp. aspx)

- Digital Health Agency Implementation Guide

- Vendor-specific training materials and documentation



### Professional Development Pathways

- Advanced AI literacy courses

- Privacy law updates and training

- Clinical audit and quality improvement methodologies

- Leadership in health technology adoption



---



## Course Delivery 


### Modular Online Learning (4-6 weeks)

- Self-paced progression through modules

- Virtual discussion forums

- Online practical exercises

- Flexible scheduling for busy practitioners






### Continuing Professional Development Integration

- RACGP CPD point allocation

- ACRRM professional development requirements

- Practice accreditation standard alignment

- Annual refresher and update sessions



This course outline provides a comprehensive foundation for safe and effective AI scribe implementation while maintaining the highest standards of patient care and professional practice in Australian general practice settings. 3 Strategic Planning
- Long-term practice technology roadmaps
- Cost-benefit analysis frameworks
- Scalability considerations for growing practices
- Succession planning and knowledge transfer

---

## Assessment and Certification

### Formative Assessment
- Module quizzes testing knowledge retention
- Case study analyses demonstrating practical application
- Group discussions and peer learning activities
- Practical exercises with real-world scenarios

### Summative Assessment
- Comprehensive case study requiring integration of legal, clinical, and practical considerations
- Development of a practice-specific AI scribe implementation plan
- Demonstration of consent procedures and patient communication
- Risk assessment and mitigation strategy presentation

### Certification Requirements
- Attendance at all modules (minimum 90%)
- Satisfactory completion of all practical exercises
- Passing grade on final assessment (75% minimum)
- Commitment to ongoing professional development in AI literacy

---

## Resources and References

### Essential Reading
- RACGP Artificial Intelligence (AI) Scribes Fact Sheet
- GPSA Position Statement: Artificial Intelligence in GP Supervision
- Avant AI Scribes Checklist
- MIPS AI Scribes Fact Sheet and Medicolegal Guidance
- ACRRM Checklist for AI-Based Scribing Software

### Supplementary Materials
- Sample consent forms and privacy policies
- Vendor comparison matrices
- Risk assessment templates
- Implementation checklists and timelines
- Case study library with real-world examples

### Online Resources
- RACGP AI in Primary Care Position Statement: [racgp
